intro: Lesquerella lescurii, commonly known as the desert lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Lesquerella lescurii produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds used in traditional herbal remedies. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
